greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Decimal expansion of Sum_{k>=1} phi(k)/2^k, where phi is Euler's totient function.
reference: Richard K. Guy, Unsolved Problems in Number Theory, Springer (2004) p. 139.
mathematica: digits = 99; m0 = 10; dd = 10; Clear[f]; f[m_] := f[m] = Sum[EulerPhi[n]/2^n, {n, 1, m}] // N[#, digits + 2*dd]&; f[m = m0] ; While[RealDigits[f[2*m], 10, digits + dd ] != RealDigits[f[m], 10, digits + dd ], m = 2*m; Print[m]]; RealDigits[f[m], 10, digits] // First
results.author: _Jean-François Alcover_, Apr 13 2015
